message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.COM 

The paper discusses the concept of reconfigurable wireless networks, which involves the adaptation and reconfiguration of hardware and software components at all layers of the protocol stack. This topic is closely related to the field of network intelligence, which involves reasoning, learning, and context awareness to enable self-organization in complex and dynamic networks. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.NI (Networks and Internet Architecture). 

The paper also discusses the impact of reconfiguration on wireless networks, which involves the optimization of network performance and user experience. This topic is related to the field of information theory (cs.IT), which deals with the transmission, processing, and storage of information. 

The paper also discusses the use of cognitive radio networks, cross-layer reconfiguration, and software-defined networks, which are all related to the field of computer networks (cs.CR). 

The paper also discusses the use of network intelligence to enable reconfiguration in highly complex and dynamic networks, which is related to the field of control systems (cs.SY). 

Finally, the paper provides examples and case studies to illustrate the impact of reconfiguration on wireless networks, which is related to the field of computer communications (cs.COM).
